snippet: American military officials have been publicly scathing in their criticism of the releases, which have brought relations between the two allies to a low point.
abstract: American military officials have been publicly scathing in their criticism of the releases of 65 prisoners in Afghanistan, which has brought relations between the two allies to a low point; release of men described as dangerous insurgents shows clearly just how thoroughly Pres Hamid Karzai has broken with American military, in country 12 years.

byline.original: By JAWAD SUKHANYAR and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar reported from Bagram, and Rod Nordland from Kabul, Afghanistan. Reporting was contributed by Azam Ahmed from Bagram, Habib Zahori and Haris Kakar from Kabul, and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington.

lead_paragraph: American military officials have been publicly scathing in their criticism of the releases, which have brought relations between the two allies to a low point.

headline.main: In Prison Release, Signs of Karzai’s Rift With U.S.
headline.print_headline: Freeing Inmates, Karzai Steps Further From U.S

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
